Description: Sets the path to the DOOM II IWAD file to use. 'Default' assumes that AMP manages the download from Steam of the client files. If that is disabled under Updates, select 'Custom' and specify Custom IWAD Path accordingly
Sets a custom path to use for the IWAD Path, if 'Custom' is selected
Sets the maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
The admin list contains a list of IPs who are considered to be administrators on the server. Administrators can bypass the Player Limit and cannot be votekicked
Inactive (AFK) players will be forced to spectators after the specified time period. 0 = disabled
Sets the control a player has over their direction while in the air
Determines if clients are allowed to send private messages to each other or the host of the server
Controls whether voice chat is enabled and who can use it
Sets the amount of time the Terminator sphere or Hellstone remains dropped before being moved to a random map spot. 0 = disabled
Defines a whitelist of IPs exempt from bans and votekicks. Use a semicolon to separate multiple files
Defines a blacklist of banned IPs. Use a semicolon to separate multiple files
Sets how often (in seconds) to reparse the banlist, whitelist, and adminlist files. 0 = only at startup or manually
Sets whether the server will broadcast to the local area network
Sets whether clients can use cheat commands on the server. Use with care!
Sets whether color codes are stripped in the server console
Sets the damage multiplier applied to all damage players receive from monsters
Sets whether Voodoo dolls are supported online
If set, all voodoo dolls are spawned when the map is loaded, no matter if the corresponding player is in the server or not

DisplayName: Coop Unassigned Voodoo Dolls For Specified Players
Description: Controls how many players the voodoo doll caters for. Dolls are spawned for players 1 to the number specified
Sets the country of the server. Use an ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code, 'automatic', or 'unknown'
If set, the server will automatically set certain dmflags for certain game modes
If set, distinguishes team chat messages from normal chat messages in the server console/logfile
If set, disables auto-triggering of certain health items for Heretic, Hexen, and Strife
If set, prevents clients from spying on other players
Customize how often points are obtained in the Domination gamemode
Controls the style for how items from monsters are dropped on the floor
Sets how many seconds the 'warm up' lasts before a duel starts
Sets whether the banlist is actually enforced or not
Sets whether the server enforces the master server's banlist
Sets how fast weapons fire
Sets how long a flag or skull remains on the ground when dropped before it is automatically returned
Combines all native vote forbidding CVars
Sets whether clients must supply a join password in order to join the game
If set, clients must be authenticated to the account-server to play
Sets whether clients must supply the correct password in order to connect to the server
Sets the amount of time that needs to pass before the player is forced to respawn
Sets how strong gravity is present in the game world. Higher values create stronger gravity
If set, allows clients to send an e-mail to the administrator of the server
Sets the display name the server has on the master server list
Sets how many seconds of 'warm-up' time before the invasion game starts and when the next wave begins
Sets the join password string the clients must supply in order to join the game
Sets how much of the monsters have to be killed before the level can be exited. Percentage value
If set, enables client commands flooding protection
Sets how many seconds of 'warm-up' time before a new LMS match starts
If a logfile with the same name is present, the server will add to the log file instead of overwriting
When generating a new log file, append the time and date to the end of the logfile name
The server logfile is written containing time stamps at every new line
The current date will be prepended to the per-line timestamp of the logfile
Measures how much bandwidth is used for both ACS scripts and actor classes
The server will use a map rotation list to determine the campaign
Sets the map rotation list. Format: addmap <mapname>. One line per map

addmap MAP02

Description: If set, all chat messages within the server console contain a 'CHAT' tag before the typed message
Determines the maximum amount of time, in minutes, that mods can ban players for using the BanFromGame ACS function. 0 means mods are forbidden from banning players
Sets how many players with the same IP can enter the server at one time
Amount of lives on the server. Only meaningful in survival and invasion modes
Sets how much data, in bytes, can be stored in a UDP packet
Maximum number of players that can join the game. Others are forced to spectate
Limit the number of packets sent from the server to clients per tick
Controls the distance at which proximity voice chat is no longer audible
Maximum amount of teams allowed. Only works if the map supports as many teams as desired
Controls the distance at which proximity voice chat will begin rolling off (becoming quieter)
Sets how many players are needed in the server in order to call a vote
Sets a message of the day on the server, a welcome message printed on clients upon connection
Manages how votes take place
If set, disables all changemap votes
If set, disables all votes to change the duel limit
If set, disables all DMFlag votes
If set, disables all votes to force players to Spec by voting
If set, disables all votes to change the frag limit
If set, disables all votes to kick players
Players may not kill themselves
If set, disables all map votes
If set, disables all nextmap votes
If set, disables all nextsecret votes
If set, disables all votes to change the point limit
If set, disables all votes to change the time limit
If set, disables all votes to change the LMS win limit
The password string clients must give to the server if they desire to connect. Only meaningful if sv_forcepassword is set
Sets how many seconds of 'warm-up' time before a new possession match starts
Sets how long a player must hold the Hellstone before scoring (in seconds)
Show messages and errors for clients not completely connected to the server in the server console
Enables proximity-based voice chat
If set, the server uses an authentication mechanism to ensure clients have the correct WADs
Flood throttle for server browser queries (in seconds)
In cooperative game modes, players are spawned at random player starts
If set, randomizes the map rotation list instead of advancing through maps in sequence
Sets the password for RCON access on the server. Empty = RCON disabled
Sets how long a player must wait after dying before they can respawn
If set, allows dead spectators to spawn at the start of a new wave in survival invasion
If set, displays the IPs of clients querying the server (for debugging)
If set, shows certain warning messages (for debugging)
Affects the behaviour of auto-aiming
Enables the skip correction which tries to smooth the movement of lagging players (temporarily disabled in Zandronum 3.1+)
When the time limit is hit and all teams have the same score, sudden death commences. The first team to score wins
Amount of warm-up in seconds in survival games
If set, the server console will contain a timestamp for all messages
Sets the format for console timestamps
If set, allows players to pickup ammunition past maximum amounts
If set, the server will identify itself to the master server and is broadcasted in the server list

DisplayName: Use Map Settings Possession Hold Time
Description: If set, the hold time set in a map definition takes precedence over sv_possessionholdtime
If set, the wave limit set in a map definition takes precedence over the wavelimit CVar
If set, team starts will be used as possible deathmatch starts in deathmatch gamemodes with teams
Store client commands in a ticbuffer and process up to two sets per server tic. Testing binaries only
Sets how many seconds must pass after a client joins before they can call a vote
Sets the cooldown between votes. 0 = cooldown disabled
Sets a website for the server. Used as the primary download location for any PWADs
Specifies additional command line arguments (anything that begins with a - ) that are not otherwise set by AMP. Use with care
Specifies additional settings to include in 'server.cfg' that are not otherwise set by AMP. One setting per line
If set, DOOM II client files (Steam App ID 2280) will not be downloaded from Steam when the server is updated. The DOOM II IWAD file must be provided manually, and the IWAD Path set accordingly
